poem:
Title: "In the wake of electric dreams"

Beneath newsprint, a murmuring chorus:
of copper-tongued ministers and doubtful peers,
Echoes of progress bearing uncertain fears.
A market woven in electric dreams, they implore us.
Cheapened Teslas, battery blues,
Yet within our grasp, the power to choose.
A gentle nudge against climate's muse,
Toward an era, quietly born anew.
